# Google Maps API Key Setup Guide
## Step 1: Create a Google Cloud Project
1. **Go to Google Cloud Console** - Visit: https://console.cloud.google.com/ - Sign in with your Google account
2. **Create a New Project** - Click "Select a project" dropdown at the top - Click "New Project" - Enter project name: `LandmarkBangladesh` (or any name you prefer) - Click "Create" - Wait for project creation to complete
## Step 2: Enable Required APIs
1. **Navigate to APIs & Services** - In the left sidebar, click "APIs & Services" → "Library"
2. **Enable Maps SDK for Android** - Search for "Maps SDK for Android" - Click on it - Click "Enable" button - Wait for activation
3. **Enable Places API (Optional but recommended)** - Search for "Places API" - Click on it and enable
## Step 3: Create API Key
1. **Go to Credentials** - In left sidebar: "APIs & Services" → "Credentials"
2. **Create Credentials** - Click "+ CREATE CREDENTIALS" - Select "API key" - Copy the generated API key immediately (save it somewhere safe)
## Step 4: Restrict Your API Key (IMPORTANT for Security)
1. **Click on your API key** to edit it
2. **Application Restrictions** - Select "Android apps" - Click "Add an item" - **Package name:** `com.example.landmarkbangladesh` - **SHA-1 certificate fingerprint:** (see below how to get this)
3. **API Restrictions** - Select "Restrict key" - Check "Maps SDK for Android" - Check "Places API" (if you enabled it) - Click "Save"
## Step 5: Get SHA-1 Certificate Fingerprint
### Method 1: Using Android Studio 1. Open your project in Android Studio 2. Open "Gradle" panel (right side) 3. Navigate to: `app` → `Tasks` → `android` → `signingReport` 4. Double-click `signingReport` 5. Check the output - copy the SHA-1 fingerprint for "debug"
### Method 2: Using Command Line ```bash # Windows (in your project directory) .\gradlew signingReport
# Look for "Variant: debug" section # Copy the SHA1 value ```
### Method 3: Using Keytool (if above methods don't work) ```bash # For debug keystore (Windows) keytool -list -v -keystore %USERPROFILE%\.android\debug.keystore -alias androiddebugkey -storepass android -keypass android ```
## Step 6: Add API Key to Your App
1. **Open AndroidManifest.xml** - File location: `app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml`
2. **Replace the placeholder** - Find this line: ```xml <meta-data android:name="com.google.android.geo.API_KEY" android:value="YOUR_API_KEY_HERE" /> ```
- Replace `YOUR_API_KEY_HERE` with your actual API key: ```xml <meta-data android:name="com.google.android.geo.API_KEY" android:value="AIzaSyBvOkBwgglku_b-OKTiDDQBVqwo8E_nMGI" /> ```
## Step 7: Enable Billing (Required)
⚠️ **Important:** Google Maps requires a billing account even for free usage
1. **Go to Billing** - In Google Cloud Console: "Billing" in left sidebar
2. **Link Billing Account** - Click "Link a billing account" - Add payment method (credit card) - **Don't worry:** Google provides $200 free credits monthly - Most mobile apps stay within free limits
3. **Free Tier Limits:** - Maps SDK for Android: 100,000 map loads per month free - This is usually sufficient for testing and small apps
## Step 8: Test Your Setup
1. **Build and run your app** 2. **Check for errors in Logcat:** - If you see "BILLING_NOT_ENABLED" - complete Step 7 - If you see "API_KEY_INVALID" - check your API key - If you see "REQUEST_DENIED" - check your SHA-1 fingerprint
## Step 9: Security Best Practices
1. **Never commit API keys to version control** - Add to `.gitignore` if using Git - Use environment variables in production
2. **Monitor usage** - Check Google Cloud Console regularly - Set up billing alerts
3. **Rotate keys regularly** - Create new keys periodically - Delete unused keys
## Troubleshooting Common Issues
### ❌ "This app won't run without Google Play Services" - **Solution:** Use an emulator with Google Play Services or real device
### ❌ Map shows but is grayed out - **Solution:** Check billing account setup and API restrictions
### ❌ "OVER_QUERY_LIMIT" error - **Solution:** Check if you exceeded free tier limits
### ❌ App crashes on map load - **Solution:** Check SHA-1 fingerprint and package name restrictions
## Quick Checklist ✓
- [ ] Google Cloud project created - [ ] Maps SDK for Android enabled - [ ] API key created - [ ] Package name restriction added: `com.example.landmarkbangladesh` - [ ] SHA-1 fingerprint added - [ ] API restrictions set (Maps SDK for Android) - [ ] Billing account linked - [ ] API key added to AndroidManifest.xml - [ ] App tested on device/emulator with Google Play Services
## Your API Key Location ``` File: app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml Line: Look for "YOUR_API_KEY_HERE" and replace it ```
Once completed, your Google Maps should load properly without ANR issues!
